authorizationServers.description: List of authorization server URLs for token validation.

jwksUri.description: URI for the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) used for token verification.

command.description: The command-line string to be executed. It can contain placeholders in the form of '{paramName}' which correspond to parameters defined in the input schema.

templateVariables.description:
Defines how input parameters are formatted into the command string.
The map key corresponds to the parameter name from the input schema.

CliInvocationConfig.description: Configuration for executing a command-line tool.

from.description: From specifies the invocation base to extend from.

extend.description: Extend adds or merges new fields into the base configuration (e.g., append to arrays, merge maps).

override.description: Override replaces fields in the base configuration with new values.

remove.description: Remove deletes specific fields from the base configuration (e.g., remove map keys, clear strings).

ExtendsConfig.description: ExtendsConfig allows extending an invocation base with modifications.

url.description:
The URL for the HTTP request.

It can contain placeholders in the form of {paramName} which correspond to parameters from the input schema.
It can contain placeholders in the form of {headers.paramName} which correspond to headers from the incoming
http request (won't work in stdio).
It can contain placeholders in the form of ${ENV_VAR_NAME} or {env.ENV_VAR_NAME} which correspond to env vars

headers.description:
The headers for the HTTP request.

Values can contain placeholders in the form of {paramName} which correspond to parameters from the input schema.
Values can contain placeholders in the form of {headers.paramName} which correspond to headers from the incoming
http request (won't work in stdio).
Values can contain placeholders in the form of ${ENV_VAR_NAME} or {env.ENV_VAR_NAME} which correspond to env vars

method.description: The HTTP method to be used for the request (e.g., "GET", "POST").

HttpInvocationConfig.description: The configuration for making an HTTP request.

oneOf.description: An invocation configuration that extends a base configuration.

InvocationConfigWrapper.description: A wrapper for invocation configurations. Must contain exactly one invocation type key (http, cli, or extends) with its corresponding configuration.

mcpFileVersion.description: Version of the MCP file format.

version.description: Semantic version of the MCP server.

runtime.description: Runtime configuration for the MCP server.

instructions.description: A set of instructions provided by the server to the client about how to use the server

invocationBases.description: InvocationBases contains base configs for invocations

tools.description: List of tools provided by the server.

prompts.description: List of prompts provided by the server.

resources.description: Set of resources available to the server.

resourceTemplates.description: Set of resource templates available to the server.

MCPFile.description: MCPFile is the root structure of an MCP configuration file.

description.description: Detailed description of what the prompt does.

arguments.description: List of template arguments for the prompt.

type.description: The type of the value. Can be a single type or an array of types.

properties.description: An object where each key is a property name and each value is a schema.

required.description: An array of required property names.

additionalProperties.description: Whether additional properties are allowed (boolean) or a schema they must match (object).

items.description: Schema for array items. Can be a single schema or an array of schemas for tuple validation.

description.description: A description of the schema's purpose.

title.description: A short title for the schema.

default.description: The default value for this schema.

const.description: A constant value that must match exactly.

$ref.description: A reference to another schema definition (e.g., '#/$defs/MyType').

$defs.description: A container for reusable schema definitions.

definitions.description: Legacy container for reusable schema definitions. Use $defs instead.

allOf.description: Must match all of the schemas in the array.

anyOf.description: Must match at least one of the schemas in the array.

oneOf.description: Must match exactly one of the schemas in the array.

multipleOf.description: Value must be a multiple of this number.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern that strings must match.

minItems.description: Minimum number of items in arrays.

maxItems.description: Maximum number of items in arrays.

uniqueItems.description: Whether array items must be unique.

minProperties.description: Minimum number of properties in objects.

maxProperties.description: Maximum number of properties in objects.

patternProperties.description: Schemas for properties matching regex patterns.

Prompt.description: Prompt represents a natural-language or LLM-style function invocation.

required.description: Indicates if the argument is mandatory.

PromptArgument.description: PromptArgument defines a variable that can be substituted into a prompt template.

size.description: The size of the raw resource content in bytes, if known.

Resource.description: Resource represents a retrievable or executable resource.

name.description: Unique identifier for the resource template.

description.description: Detailed description of the resource template.

mimeType.description: MIME type for resources matching this template.

uriTemplate.description: URI template (RFC 6570) used to construct resource URIs.

ResourceTemplate.description: ResourceTemplate represents a reusable URI-based template for resources.

transportProtocol.description: Transport protocol to use (streamablehttp or stdio).

streamableHttpConfig.description: Configuration for streamable HTTP transport protocol.

ServerRuntime.description: ServerRuntime defines transport protocol and associated configuration.

StdioConfig.description: StdioConfig defines configuration for stdio transport protocol.

basePath.description: Base path for the MCP server (default: /mcp).

stateless.description: Indicates whether the server is stateless (default: true when unset).

StreamableHTTPConfig.description: StreamableHTTPConfig defines configuration for the HTTP-based runtime.

certFile.description: Absolute path to the server's public certificate.

keyFile.description: Absolute path to the server's private key.

TLSConfig.description: TLSConfig defines paths to TLS certificate and private key files.

format.description:
Template is the format string for the variable. It can be a simple string or contain template variables like '{paramName}'.
For example, "--user={username}" or "--verbose".

omitIfFalse.description:
OmitIfFalse, if true, causes the template to be omitted entirely if the input
value is a boolean `false`. This is useful for optional flags like "--force".

TemplateVariable.description: The formatting for a single parameter in the command template

invocation.description: Object describing how to execute the tool.

requiredScopes.description: OAuth scopes required to invoke this tool.

annotations.description: Annotations to indicate tool behaviour to the client.

Tool.description: Tool represents an executable capability of the MCP server.

destructiveHint.description:
If true, the tool may perform destructive updates to its environment. If
false, the tool performs only additive updates

idempotentHint.description:
If true, calling the tool repeatedly with the same arguments will have no additional
effect on its environment

openWorldHint.description:
If true, this tool may interact with an "open world" or external entities. If
false, this tool's domain of interaction is closed. For example, the world of
a web search tool is open, whereas that of a memory tool is not.

readOnlyHint.description: If true, the tool does not modify its environment
